page.title: 11Farming-Commercial-Lethenty
page.content: Lethenty forms one part of a farming unit comprising East Balhalgardy, Lethenty and another smaller farm which falls just to the north of our block. The land is owned by Mr Maitland of East Balhalgardy and is used mostly for grazing cattle and growing barley and wheat. The farm buildings are used for storing silage and for housing calves before they are old enough to be put out to grass. Next to the farm buildings is what used to be Lethenty Mill to which local farmers brought their grain to be processed and returned to them as cattle food. Nowadays the buildings at Lethenty Mill are used by a manufacturer of pine household furniture and as a car repair workshop.
